gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class BoundingRectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.BoundingRectangle

  • public final class BoundingRectangle
extends java.lang.Object
    A bounding rectangle for a 3-dimensional polygon. The bounding rectangle is the smallest rectangle that encloses a set of points. A point is contained in the rectangle if it lies within its boundary or on one of its edges. Thus, the bounding rectangle includes its boundary.

    Special processing is conducted for LatLonAlt objects (including those emmbedded in Position objects. The special processing includes (1) altitude information is captured as a bound, but not used in the "contains" operation, and (2) proper handling when the longitude "wraps around" at -180/180. This second special processing means that a bounding rectangle for LatLonAlt is limited to 180 degrees (half the earth). Very erratic results will come from a bounding rectangle that has both LatLonAlt points and normal euclidean points.

    This probably should have been called BoundingBox, because it is three dimensional.

      • denormalize

        public LatLonAlt denormalize(LatLonAlt lla)
        Return a LatLonAlt object that is consistent with this bounding rectangle. This LatLonAlt object may have a longitude greater than 180 degrees or less than -180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        lla - a LatLonAlt object
        Returns:
        a LatLonAlt object with (possibly) non-standard longitude.

      • denormalize

        public Position denormalize(Position p)
        Return a Position object that is consistent with this bounding rectangle. If this bounding rectangle contains latitude/longitude points, then the returned Position object may have a longitude greater than 180 degrees or less than -180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        p - a Position object
        Returns:
        a LatLonAlt object with (possibly) non-standard longitude.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
        Determines if the given point is within the bounding rectangle. A point on the edges of this rectangle is also within the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point in question
        y - the y coordinate of the point in question
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the bounding rectangle or on any of its edges.

        Returns:
        true, if the supplied BoundingRectangle intersects this one

      • centerPos

        public Position centerPos()
        Return center Position for this BoundingRectangle. If any LatLonAlt values were input to the BoundingRectangle, this will be a normalized (within [-pi,+pi]) LatLonAlt position.
